name: Pardot
description: Add a Pardot Instance to connect your existing Pardot account to the Marketing Hub, allowing you to manage accounts, campaigns, contacts, leads etc. across multiple Marketing Elements. You will need your Pardot account information to add an instance.
configDescription: If you do not have an Pardot account, you can create one at Pardot Signup

configuration.name: Event Notification Subscription ID
configuration.description: The subscription ID for the webhook events subscription

configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter
configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector

configuration.name: Pardot API Version
configuration.description: You can set this to 4 if you have version 4 enabled in the account

configuration.name: Filter null values from the response
configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses.

configuration.name: Default select fields
configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings

configuration.name: Event poller refresh interval
configuration.description: Used for how often to poll the application (in minutes)

configuration.name: Event Poller Resources Configuration
Callback Notification Signature Key
configuration.description: A key used to generate a validation hash header of the event/bulk notification webhook callback payload

configuration.name: Event Poller Filter
configuration.description: Filter comparing two parameters to be applied to the poller where clause. This will be a comma seperated list formated with the object then the filter. i.e. contacts='billAddr == shipAddr'

resources.description: Find the activities in the Marketing Automation system, using the given, optional CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all activities whose type contains the word 'email', the search expression parameter will be where=type like '%email%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned. If there are no matches to search expression empty results are returned.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for activities created after 'Jan 15, 2015', the search expression will be created_after='2015-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. Other accepted search criteria are updated_after, updated_before, created_after, and id_greater_than=12 (or any positive integer) or id_less_than=12 (or any positive integer). When this parameter is omitted, all activities are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to the Pardot max page size of 200 if not supplied

created_at.description: Time that visitor activity occurred; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone.

details.description: Details about this visitor activity such as the name of the object associated with this activity, the search phrase used in a site search query, etc.

email_id.description: Pardot ID of the email template associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has an email associated with it

email_template_id.description: Pardot ID of the email template associated with this visitor activity Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has an email associated with it

file_id.description: Pardot ID of the file associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a file associated with it

form_handler_id.description: Pardot ID of the form handler associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a form handler associated with it

form_id.description: Pardot ID of the form associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a form associated with it

id.description: Pardot ID for this visitor activity.

landing_page_id.description: Pardot ID of the landing page associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a landing page associated with it

list_email_id.description: Pardot ID of the list email associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has an email associated with it

multivariate_test_variation_id.description: Pardot ID of the multivariate test variation associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a multivariate test variation associated with it

paid_search_id_id.description: Pardot ID of the paid search ad associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a paid search ad associated with it

prospect_id.description: Pardot ID for the associated prospect.

site_search_query_id.description: Pardot ID of the site search query associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a site search query associated with it

visitor_id.description: Pardot ID for the associated visitor.

visitor_page_view_id.description: Pardot ID of the visitor page view associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a visitor page view associated with it

resources.description:
Find campaigns in the Marketing Automation system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all campaigns whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

If a value of true is specified for the includeDeleted flag, then any soft-deleted records will also be considered in the searched records.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for campaigns created after 'Jan 15, 2015', the search expression will be created_after='2015-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. Other accepted search criteria are updated_after, updated_before, created_after, and id_greater_than=12 (or any positive integer) or id_less_than=12 (or any positive integer), and name='exat campaign name'. When this parameter is omitted, all campaigns are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to the Pardot max page size of 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Specify if deleted campaigns should be included in the search.

resources.description: Create a new campaign in the Marketing Automation service. Campaign creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your Marketing Automation service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Campaign' model are those required to create a new campaign.

parameters.name: campaign
parameters.description:
The campaign object to be created.
With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Campaign' model are those required to create a new campaign.

CampaignPost.description: A campaign object. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated are those required to create a new campaign. For other campaign operations, the required fields will be a subset of these fields. There will be other fields returned with a Campaign, which are not all described here.

resources.description: Retrieve a campaign associated with a given ID from your Marketing Automation system.  Specifying a campaign associated with a given ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to retrieve from the Marketing Automation system.

resources.description: Update the campaign associated with the given ID in the Marketing Automation system. The update API uses the PATCH HTTP verb, so only those fields provided in the campaign object will be updated, and those fields not provided will be left alone.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign to update in the Marketing Automation system.

parameters.name: campaignPatch
parameters.description: The campaign object, with those fields that are to be updated.

CampaignPatch.description: The campaign object, with those fields that are to be updated.

resources.description: Add contacts to the campaign associated with the given campaign ID. This API assumes that the contacts already exist in the Marketing Automation system, and simply links the contacts with the campaign. If there is an error while adding contact to campaign will be added in Elements-Error response header and process the remaining contacts.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign, to which contacts need to be added.

parameters.name: campaignContacts
parameters.description: The contact objects which needs to be added to the campaign. This object has a different set of attributes than the Contact model object.

CampaignContact.description: A contact object in a campaign.

resources.description: Add leads to the campaign associated with the given campaign ID. This API assumes that the leads already exist in the Marketing Automation system, and simply links the leads with the campaign.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the campaign, to which leads need to be added.

parameters.name: campaignLeads
parameters.description: The lead objects which needs to be added to the campaign. This object has a different set of attributes than the Lead model object.

CampaignLead.description: A lead object in a campaign.

resources.description:
Find contacts in the Marketing Automation system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all contacts whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

If a value of true is specified for the includeDeleted flag, then any soft-deleted records will also be considered in the searched records.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for contacts created after 'Jan 15, 2015', the search expression will be created_after='2015-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. Other accepted search criteria are updated_after, updated_before, created_after, and id_greater_than=12 (or any positive integer) or id_less_than=12 (or any positive integer). When this parameter is omitted, all contacts are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to the Pardot max page size of 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Specify if deleted contacts should be included in the search.

id.description: Pardot ID for this profile criteria

matches.description: The matching status of this profile criteria with the current prospect

Contact.description: A contact object. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated are those required to create a new contact. For other contact operations, the required fields will be a subset of these fields. There will be other fields returned with a Contact, which are not all described here.

campaign_id.description: Pardot ID of the campaign associated with this prospect

created_at.description: Time prospect was created in Pardot; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

crm_account_fid.description: Account ID in a supported CRM system

crm_contact_fid.description: Prospect's contact ID in a supported CRM system

crm_last_sync.description: Last time this prospect was synced with a supported CRM system

crm_lead_fid.description: Prospect's lead ID in a supported CRM system

crm_owner_fid.description: Prospect's owner ID in a supported CRM system

crm_url.description: URL to view the prospect within the CRM system

is_do_not_call.description: If value is 1, prospect prefers not to be called

is_do_not_email.description: If value is 1, prospect prefers not to be emailed

is_reviewed.description: If value is 1, prospect has been reviewed

is_starred.description: If value is 1, prospect has been starred

last_activity_at.description: Time stamp of this prospect's latest visitor activity; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

opted_out.description: If value is 1, prospect has opted out of marketing communications

recent_interaction.description: Describes the prospect's most recent interaction with Pardot

updated_at.description: Last time prospect was updated in Pardot; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

years_in_business.description: Prospect's number of years in business

created_at.description: Time list was created in Pardot; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

is_crm_visible.description: If true, list will be visible in CRM to add or remove from

is_dynamic.description: If true, list has prospects dynamically added to it via a set of chosen rules.

is_public.description: If true, list will show on EPC pages to prospects

updated_at.description: Last time list was updated; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

resources.description: Find the activities of a contact associated with given ID, using the given, optional CEQL search expression.  If the contact does not exist, an error response will be returned.  If no search expression is provided, then all the activities in the contact will be returned.  If no activities are found in the given contact or none are found matching the given search expression, then an empty array will be returned.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for contacts last modified on or after 'Jan 15, 2014', the search expression will be where=lastModifiedDate>='2014-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. When this parameter is omitted, all contacts are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to the Pardot max page size of 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A contact ID to find activities from.

created_at.description: Time that visitor activity occurred; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone.

details.description: Details about this visitor activity such as the name of the object associated with this activity, the search phrase used in a site search query, etc.

email_id.description: Pardot ID of the email template associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has an email associated with it

email_template_id.description: Pardot ID of the email template associated with this visitor activity Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has an email associated with it

file_id.description: Pardot ID of the file associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a file associated with it

form_handler_id.description: Pardot ID of the form handler associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a form handler associated with it

form_id.description: Pardot ID of the form associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a form associated with it

id.description: Pardot ID for this visitor activity.

landing_page_id.description: Pardot ID of the landing page associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a landing page associated with it

list_email_id.description: Pardot ID of the list email associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has an email associated with it

multivariate_test_variation_id.description: Pardot ID of the multivariate test variation associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a multivariate test variation associated with it

paid_search_id_id.description: Pardot ID of the paid search ad associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a paid search ad associated with it

prospect_id.description: Pardot ID for the associated prospect.

site_search_query_id.description: Pardot ID of the site search query associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a site search query associated with it

visitor_id.description: Pardot ID for the associated visitor.

visitor_page_view_id.description: Pardot ID of the visitor page view associated with this visitor activity. Note: This node will only appear if this visitor activity has a visitor page view associated with it

resources.description: Find the Campaigns this contact belongs to.

parameters.name: nextPage
parameters.description: The token or link for getting the next page. This type of paging is a cursor based paging. Where you have to start at the beginning and traverse the result set.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to the Pardot max page size of 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A contact ID to find activities from.

resources.description: Get the email statistics for a given list email

parameters.name: listEmailId

resources.description: Retrieve a list of forms

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for forms created after Jan 15, 2015, the search expression will be created_after=2015-01-15T00:00:00.000Z. Other accepted search criteria are updated_after, updated_before, created_after, created_before, id_greater_than, and id_less_than. When this parameter is omitted, all forms are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to the Pardot max page size of 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: Format JSON

parameters.name: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
parameters.description: Content-Type Header

resources.description: Retrieve a form

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Form ID

resources.description:
Find leads in the Marketing Automation system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all leads whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

If a value of true is specified for the includeDeleted flag, then any soft-deleted records will also be considered in the searched records.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for leads created after 'Jan 15, 2015', the search expression will be created_after='2015-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. Other accepted search criteria are updated_after, updated_before, created_after, and id_greater_than=12 (or any positive integer) or id_less_than=12 (or any positive integer). When this parameter is omitted, all leads are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to the Pardot max page size of 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Specify if deleted leads should be included in the search.

campaign_id.description: Pardot ID of the campaign associated with this opportunity

created_at.description: Time opportunity was created in Pardot; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

updated_at.description: Last time opportunity was updated in Pardot; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

resources.description: Retrieve a list's metadata from the Marketing Automation system

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for campaigns created after 'Jan 15, 2015', the search expression will be created_after='2015-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. Other accepted search criteria are updated_after, updated_before, created_after, and id_greater_than=12 (or any positive integer) or id_less_than=12 (or any positive integer), and name='exat campaign name'. When this parameter is omitted, all campaigns are returned in a paginated fashion.

resources.description:
Find contacts in a given list in the Marketing Automation system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all contacts whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

If a value of true is specified for the includeDeleted flag, then any soft-deleted records will also be considered in the searched records.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for contacts last modified on or after 'Jan 15, 2014', the search expression will be where=lastModifiedDate>='2014-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. When this parameter is omitted, all contacts are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to the Pardot max page size of 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Specify if deleted contacts should be included in the search.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A list ID to find contacts from.

id.description: Pardot ID for this profile criteria

matches.description: The matching status of this profile criteria with the current prospect

Contact.description: A contact object. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated are those required to create a new contact. For other contact operations, the required fields will be a subset of these fields. There will be other fields returned with a Contact, which are not all described here.

campaign_id.description: Pardot ID of the campaign associated with this prospect

created_at.description: Time prospect was created in Pardot; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

crm_account_fid.description: Account ID in a supported CRM system

crm_contact_fid.description: Prospect's contact ID in a supported CRM system

crm_last_sync.description: Last time this prospect was synced with a supported CRM system

crm_lead_fid.description: Prospect's lead ID in a supported CRM system

crm_owner_fid.description: Prospect's owner ID in a supported CRM system

crm_url.description: URL to view the prospect within the CRM system

is_do_not_call.description: If value is 1, prospect prefers not to be called

is_do_not_email.description: If value is 1, prospect prefers not to be emailed

is_reviewed.description: If value is 1, prospect has been reviewed

is_starred.description: If value is 1, prospect has been starred

last_activity_at.description: Time stamp of this prospect's latest visitor activity; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

opted_out.description: If value is 1, prospect has opted out of marketing communications

recent_interaction.description: Describes the prospect's most recent interaction with Pardot

updated_at.description: Last time prospect was updated in Pardot; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

years_in_business.description: Prospect's number of years in business

created_at.description: Time list was created in Pardot; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

is_crm_visible.description: If true, list will be visible in CRM to add or remove from

is_dynamic.description: If true, list has prospects dynamically added to it via a set of chosen rules.

is_public.description: If true, list will show on EPC pages to prospects

updated_at.description: Last time list was updated; Time is reported in API user's preferred timezone

resources.description: Add contacts to the lists associated with the given list ID. This API assumes that the contacts already exist in the Pardot system, and simply links the contacts with the list. If there is an error while adding contact to list will be added in Elements-Error response header and process the remaining contacts.

resources.description: Find visitors in the Marketing Automation system, using the provided CEQL search expression.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression, or the where clause, without the WHERE keyword, in a typical SQL query. For example, to search for visitors created after 'Jan 15, 2015', the search expression will be created_after='2015-01-15T00:00:00.000Z'. Other accepted search criteria are updated_after, updated_before, created_after, and id_greater_than=12 (or any positive integer) or id_less_than=12 (or any positive integer). When this parameter is omitted, all visitors are returned in a paginated fashion.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to the Pardot max page size of 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: onlyIdentified
parameters.description: Specify if identified visitors should be included in the search.

campaign_parameter.description: Visitor's campaign parameter utm_campaign from Google Analytics

content_parameter.description: Visitor's content parameter utm_content from Google Analytics

medium_parameter.description: Visitor's medium parameter utm_medium from Google Analytics

page_view_count.description: Number of page views by this visitor

source_parameter.description: Visitor's source parameter utm_source from Google Analytics

term_parameter.description: Visitor's term parameter utm_term from Google Analytics

objects.name: visitors
objects.description: Represent contacts with a known email address in Pardot

objects.name: lists
objects.description: A list object is a marketing list of subscribers

objects.name: leads
objects.description: Represents an opportunity, which is a sale or pending deal

objects.name: contacts
objects.description: Represents a contact, which is a person associated with an account

objects.name: campaigns
objects.description: Represents and tracks a marketing campaign, such as a direct mail promotion, webinar, or trade show
objects.notes: Events are not supported, as we don't have enough data for poller.

objects.name: activities
objects.description: An activity represents a website visit from a visitor

objects.name: visits
objects.notes: -- Bulk download is supported with a mandatory where clause.  (ex: select * from visits where visitor_ids=1234,4567,7891)\n-- This object is similar to 'visitorsVisits'

objects.name: listsContacts
objects.description: Represents contacts that are subscribed to lists
objects.notes: -- This API calls 'prospect' object behind the sceens, with where clause includes 'list_id'\n-- This object supports bulk upload and download thrugh where cluase param 'list_id'. (ex: "select * from prospect where list_id=1234")

objects.name: contactsLists
objects.notes: -- It is just a retrive call for `contacts' and we are fetching the 'lists.list_subscription' object from the response.\n-- Bulk operations can be performed through 'contacts' object with where clause.

objects.name: contactsCampaigns
objects.notes: -- It is just a retrive call for `contacts' and we are fetching the campaigns object from the response.\n-- Bulk download can be performed through 'contacts' object with where clause.

objects.name: contactsActivities
objects.notes: -- It is nothing but calling 'activities' object with where clause includes `contact id`.\n-- Bulk download is supported as part of 'activities' object.

objects.name: campaignsContacts
objects.notes:
-- Actually updating the `campaign field` for Contacts object.

-- When you do a PUT on this Object it actually updates the `contacts` object with the given 'campaign ID' and returns 200 with no response.  
-- We can do BULK upload for this object indirectly with 'contacts' object.

objects.name: campaignsLeads
objects.notes:
-- Actually updating the `campaign field` for Leads object.

-- When you do a PUT on this Object it actually updates the `lead` object with the given 'campaign ID' and returns 200 with no response.  
-- We can do BULK upload for this object indirectly with 'leads' object.

objects.name: visitorsContacts
objects.description: Associate a Visitor with a Prospect
